content.description: This is the slab with knobs, and the crux is getting above the crack in the first 7 feet. Great problem. Stand on the flake at the base and reach for a horizontal crack and smear to reach some crimps and the top. Bring a good pad and another friend to move the pad on top of the flake at the base after you start.
content.protection: One three inch thick pad would be fine. Make sure to have someone to move the pad.
content.location:
This is the obvious slab to the left of

Afternoon Beer

. Look for a small flake leaning against the wall.

content.description:
Discovered and cleaned by Tom Hanson over beers before the start of the first Devil's Head Blowout. This is sure to become the "Midnight Lightning" of Camp 11.

Well, probably not. But it is still worth checking out while you are in camp.
content.protection: A fairly clean landing. The biggest hazard is spilling you beer.
content.location: The obvious roof on the boulder just south of the fire pit.
